review: I've used both a Chromecast and the Fire Stick TV for about a month. Both were OK in certain ways, and both had problems.The biggest drawback for me with the Chromecast is that it's rarely able to get the correct aspect ratio, so a lot of videos are cut off on the top or edges. The other problem is that without a remote, I have to run to my computer a lot to make changes.The Fire Stick problems are two: it loses the wifi connection if I stop using it for a few hours, so I need to reboot it frequently. Sometimes it doesn't regain the connection at all, and I just give up for a few hours. The other big problem is that the responsiveness of the device sometimes gets terrible; the remote seems to stop responding and commands back up in the queue. After 10-20 seconds, all the commands are run quickly in sequence.The other minor downside of the Fire Stick is that typing out search queries with the remote is pretty irritating. But I hear I can download an Android app that will let me do voice commands, or use a normal keyboard.When it's working, the Fire Stick is pretty terrific. I hope that updates will fix both of these problems.
